title: A Successful Story about Management and Operation of the Facilities at Irvine Materials Research Institute
content: Irvine Materials Research Institute (IMRI) at the University of California-Irvine (UCI) houses world-class facilities for materials characterization and biomolecular analysis. There are 6 transmission electron microscopes (TEMs) and 4 scanning electron microscopes (SEMs) together with other microscopy and microanalysis instruments and a full set of specimen preparation equipment in the IMRI facilities, including NION UltraSTEM 200 HERMES and double-corrected JEOL Grand ARM 300F S/TEM. We witnessed the development of materials characterization facilities at UCI and participated in their management and operation in the last 17 years. Here we share with you a successful story about the development, management, and operation of materials characterization facilities at UCI.
